item.title: 'Absolutely appalled': DHB boss yanks racist vaccine booklet
item.description:
A Covid-19 vaccine information booklet using Māori faces on cartoon virus figures has been immediately withdrawn from circulation after it was deemed racist.
An investigation has been launched after ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202130/covidmaori_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Rotorua-based MP Tamati Coffey last night described the booklet as "wrong on so many levels" saying it could be seen as racist.

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202130/covidboot3_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=A vaccine booklet has come under fire for its inappropriate use of Maori imagery. Photo / Supplied

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202130/covidboot_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The Bay of Plenty District Health Board has come under fire after publishing a vaccine information booklet deemed by its chief executive as offensive. Photo / Supplied

item.title: Sky-high house prices haven't put first home buyers off, but could rising interest rates?
item.description:
First home buyers are buying more houses but are also at greatest risk should interest rates rise and add thousands of dollars to their mortgage repayments.
That's according to analysts CoreLogic, who ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202130/A_090221NHZHISIGNS14_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=First-home buyers are buying more houses but are also at greatest risk should interest rates rise. Photo / Fiona Goodall

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202130/91270486_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=New buyers are spending so much buying homes in Wellington and Auckland, the size of their debts could leave them vulnerable to rate rises. Photo / 123rf
